com.ibm.team.repository.client

Interface ITeamRepository

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IEventSource

    public interface ITeamRepository
extends IEventSource
    Represents a team repository.

    Team repository objects are intended to be used by multi-threaded clients. Unless noted, the methods on ITeamRepository can be safely called from multiple threads concurrently without risk of corruption.

    The team repository object serves as the context for subsequent interactions with that repository. Acquiring a team repository object allows the client to login to the repository. Once logged in, the client can retrieve, create, and modify items in the repository, and can continue to do so until the client explicitly logs out. Logging in requires the client (end user) be authenticated; the repository may periodically request the client to re-authenticate (even though they have not indicated that they want to log out). Although the client remains logged in, they will be unable to pass information between them and the repository until they successfully re-authenticate. When a client is finished their conversation with a sever/repository, they explicitly log out. Once logged out, the team repository object is reset to its initial state ready for the next login. In other words, the client controls the login and logout process (a repository cannot summarily logout a client). Attempting to access the repository while not logged in will generally result in a NotLoggedInException

    Since:
    0.5

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  ITeamRepository.ILoginHandler
      Handler for acquiring user id and password when a repository is about to be logged in to with #login(), or whenever the repository decides to challenge an already logged-in client (as determined by that repository's security policies).
      static interface  ITeamRepository.ILoginParticipant
      Login participant interface to be implemented by clients that are interested in contributing to the login/logout function.

      • STATE_LOGGING_IN

        static final int STATE_LOGGING_IN
        A getState() property constant indicating that the repository is currently attempting to log in, but the login attempt is not yet successful.

        Calls to login will block until the connection attempt succeeds or is canceled by the user. loggedIn() returns false.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_LOGGED_IN

        static final int STATE_LOGGED_IN
        A getState() property constant indicating that the repository is currently logged in.

        Calls to login will succeed immediately and loggedIn() returns true.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_LOGGING_OUT

        static final int STATE_LOGGING_OUT
        A getState() property constant indicating that the repository is currently in the process of logging out.

        At this point, logout() was called, but there are still active connections. Existing connections are still usable, but new logins will fail. loggedIn returns true.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_LOGGED_OUT

        static final int STATE_LOGGED_OUT
        A getState() property constant indicating that the repository is currently logged out.

        No login was requested by the user. loggedIn() returns false.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_STATE_NONE

        static final int ERROR_STATE_NONE
        A getErrorState() property constant indicating that the repository is not in an error state.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_STATE_IO

        static final int ERROR_STATE_IO
        A getErrorState() property constant indicating that the repository is currently unavailable. This can be caused by network problems or simply that the repository is unavailable. For details about the exact cause of the error use getLastError().

        It's important that clients don't try and auto-reconnect to a repository in this state as it can result in an overflow of connection error messages. Instead, the user should be responsible for trying to re-connect and clients should listen to state changes to the repository to know when the repository has transitioned from an error state to being logged-in.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_STATE_AUTH

        static final int ERROR_STATE_AUTH
        A getErrorState() property constant indicating that the repository is currently unavailable because of an authentication problem. For details about the exact cause of the error call getLastError().
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEBUG_NONE

        static final int DEBUG_NONE
        A #setDebugMode() property constant indicating that this unmanaged team repository not be in debug mode.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEBUG_BLOCKING_SERVICEMETHODS

        static final int DEBUG_BLOCKING_SERVICEMETHODS
        A #setDebugMode() property constant indicating that this unmanaged team repository will block for the specified timeout period before each service invocation. This is useful for testing responsiveness to cancellation requests or any other tests can require synchronization before a service method is called.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • root

        IRepositoryRoot root()
        Returns the repository root. The client need not be logged in to this repository.

        The full state of the repository root is retrieved at the time of login.

        Returns:
        the repository root, or null if the client has never logged in to this repository

      • publicUriRoot

        java.lang.String publicUriRoot()
        Returns the root of the absolute URI used when identifying resources via a public domain, as noted by this repository.

        While this repository may be hosted on and addressed as the host "privateHost.com", URIs to resources identified by this host may need to be constructed using a public alias such as "jazz.net". The value of this method should then be used as the repository URI to construct locations that will need to refer to this public site.

        Returns:
        The public URI root used to construct public locations. Will be null if this repository has no such alias. If non-null, never contains a trailing "/" or "\\".

      • registerLoginHandler

        void registerLoginHandler(ITeamRepository.ILoginHandler handler)
        Registers the login handler that will be asked for user id and password whenever the client explicitly logs in (via #login(), or whenever the repository decides to challenge an already logged-in client (as determined by that repository's security policies). The client need not be logged in to this repository.
        Parameters:
        handler - the handler to use for client-instigated #login() or server-initiated challenges, or null to clear the login handler

      • registerLoginHandler

        void registerLoginHandler(ILoginHandler2 handler)

      • registerOAuthHandler

        void registerOAuthHandler(com.ibm.team.repository.transport.client.IOAuthHandler handler)
        Registers the OAuth handler that is associated to this TeamRepository and the ITeamRawRestServiceClient instance that it manages.

        While calling this method is a short operation, it does synchronize on the ITeamRawRestServiceClient instance to ensure that it is currently not in use when the handler is being set.

        The associated handler only affects new connections created via ITeamRawRestServiceClient.getConnection(java.net.URI) or ITeamRawRestServiceClient#getConnection(java.net.URL) - existing connections are not affected.

        Parameters:
        handler - The OAuthHandler implementation. May be null.
        Since:
        0.7

        Parameters:

      • login

        void login(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
           throws TeamRepositoryException
        Login to the server for this team repository. The user id and password are obtained from the registered login handler. Most operations on a team repository require a prior log-in. If already logged in, this method will do nothing. This operation fails if the server does not recognize the user id and password supplied. There must be a registered login handler. The method will retry the login three times.

        Use registerLoginHandler(ITeamRepository.ILoginHandler)to register a handler. When #login()is called, the handler's ILoginHandler#challenge()method is called to obtain a ITeamRepository.ILoginHandler.ILoginInfoobject. The ITeamRepository.ILoginHandler.ILoginInfo.getUserId()and ITeamRepository.ILoginHandler.ILoginInfo.getPassword()methods are called on this object to obtain the user id and password that will then be offered to the repository.

        Use IOfflineManager#setStartupExpectations(boolean, boolean) to configure online/offline expectations different from defaults (online and offline-disabled) prior to login.

        Login will fail throwing a TeamRepositoryException, if a version mismatch related to the core meta-data is found between the client and the server.

        Parameters:
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if the login was unsuccessful for any reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • login

        void login(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor,
         boolean skipVersionCheck)
           throws TeamRepositoryException
        Same functionality as login(IProgressMonitor), except that the version check is skipped. This is intended only to be used with clients that want to perform some migration from a newer client on an older client.
        Parameters:
        monitor -
        skipVersionCheck -
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException

      • logout

        void logout()
        Logout of this repository. Does nothing if the client is not logged in. Most operations on a team repository require a prior log-in. State changes for this repository are broadcasted during the logout process, see getState().

      • logout

        @Deprecated
void logout(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
            throws TeamRepositoryException
        Deprecated. use logout()
        Logout of this repository. Does nothing if the client is not logged in. Most operations on a team repository require a prior log-in. State changes for this repository are broadcasted during the logout process, see getState().
        Parameters:
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if the logout was unsuccessful for any reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • loggedIn

        boolean loggedIn()
        Returns whether the client is logged in to this repository. This is functionally equivalent to calling getState() == STATE_LOGGED_IN.
        Returns:
        true if logged in, and false if not logged in

      • loggedInContributor

        IContributor loggedInContributor()
        Returns the contributor that is currently logged in. The client need not be logged in to this repository.

        The full state of the contributor is retrieved at the time of login.

        [We're assuming that the contributor is uniquely identified from the userID supplied at login() time.]

        Returns:
        the contributor currently logged in, or null if the client is not logged in to this repository

        Returns:
        the URI of the repository and repository; the syntax conforms to RFC 3986; never null

        • STATE_LOGGED_IN

      • setId

        void setId(UUID id)
        Sets the id of this repository. The id must match the item id of the repository root object.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the repository; could be null
        See Also:
        getId()

      • getId

        UUID getId()
        Returns the id of this repository. The id of the repository is the item identifier of the repository root object. The id of the repository will be set after a successful login.

        Clients could optionally persist the repository id along with the repository URI and name and set it by calling setId. This will help ITeamRepositoryService.getTeamRepository(String, IProgressMonitor) avoid returning a new repository handle while another handle that uses a slightly different URI already exists.

        Returns:
        the id for this repository; or null if an id hasn't been set.

      • getAliasRepositoryURIs

        java.util.Collection getAliasRepositoryURIs()
        Returns the alias repository URIs for this repository.

        Clients could optionally persist the alias repository URIs along with the actual repository URI and name and restore them back it by calling addAliasRepositoryURI. This will help ITeamRepositoryService.getTeamRepository(String, IProgressMonitor) and ITeamRepositoryService.getTeamRepository(String) avoid returning a new repository handle while another handle that uses a slightly different URI already exists.

        Returns:
        the collection (element type: String) of alias repository URIs for this repository which is never null.

      • setUserId

        void setUserId(java.lang.String userId)
        Sets the userid to use when logging in to this repository. If the repository is already logged in, changing the userid won't change the currently logged in user.
        Parameters:
        userId - the new user id; could be null

      • getUserId

        java.lang.String getUserId()
        Returns the user id being used to login to this repository. Note that this is the user id that the end user typed into a log in dialog (perhaps differing in case) and not necessarily the jazz contributor user id. These two values can be different in some SSO configurations. If the jazz contributor id is required, use loggedInContributor() and then call IContributor.getUserId().
        Returns:
        the user id being used to login to this repository; or null if a user id hasn't been set.

      • setConnectionTimeout

        void setConnectionTimeout(int timeoutInSeconds)
        Sets the connection timeout for contacting the repository. This is used to determine how long to wait when connecting to the remote repository. The default is 60 seconds. Changing this setting does not affect operations that are already in progress.
        Parameters:
        timeoutInSeconds - the connection timeout in seconds; must be non-negative

      • getConnectionTimeout

        int getConnectionTimeout()
        Returns the connection timeout used for contacting the repository.
        Returns:
        the connection timeout in seconds for contacting the repository; always non-negative

      • statistics

        IStatistics statistics()
        Returns statistics about this team repository instance.
        Returns:
        statistics object about this team repository instance, which is never null

      • setDebugMode

        void setDebugMode(int mode)
        Puts this team repository into the specified debug mode. This is for testing purposes only, for this reason only unmanaged team repository can be put into debug mode.
        Parameters:
        mode - the debug mode DEBUG_NONE or DEBUG_BLOCKING_SERVICEMETHODS

      • setProxy

        void setProxy(java.lang.String host,
            java.lang.String type,
            int port,
            java.lang.String userName,
            java.lang.String password)
        Configure an HTTP proxy to use when connecting to the repository server.
        Parameters:
        host - the host name of the proxy, or null if no proxy is used.
        type - the type of the proxy ("http" or "https"). Maybe null. If null "http" is assumed.
        port - the port of the proxy; disregarded if host is null.
        userName - the user name to use for authenticating to the proxy, or null if the proxy doesn't require authentication; disregarded if host is null.
        password - the password to use for authenticating to the proxy; disregarded if either host or userName is null.

      • setProxy

        @Deprecated
void setProxy(java.lang.String host,
                       int port,
                       java.lang.String userName,
                       java.lang.String password)
        Deprecated. See setProxy(String, String, int, String, String)
        Configure a proxy to use when connecting to the repository server.
        Parameters:
        host - the host name of the proxy, or null if no proxy is used.
        port - the port of the proxy; disregarded if host is null.
        userName - the user name to use for authenticating to the proxy, or null if the proxy doesn't require authentication; disregarded if host is null.
        password - the password to use for authenticating to the proxy; disregarded if either host or userName is null.

      • getMayLogIntoJts

        boolean getMayLogIntoJts()
        Returns whether this repository may log into a JTS server.
        Returns:
        true if this repository is configured to allow JTS logins

      • getRawRestServiceClient

        com.ibm.team.repository.transport.client.ITeamRawRestServiceClient getRawRestServiceClient()
        Since:
        0.7

      • getLoginInfo

        ILoginInfo2 getLoginInfo()

      • setLoginInfo

        void setLoginInfo(ILoginInfo2 loginInfo)

      • changeRepositoryURI

        void changeRepositoryURI(java.lang.String newURI)

        Change the URI of the repository that this object connects to. This must be a different URI for the same repository. It may not be a completely different repository. It is the caller's responsibility to check that, such as by comparing the repository IDs of the two URIs.

        The user will be logged out of the repository at the old location, and will not be logged back in at the new location. loggedIn() will always be false after this method is called.

        Parameters:
        newURI - The new URI to use for this repository.

      • getRetryPolicy

        IRetryPolicy getRetryPolicy()
        The retry policy dictates what to do when a service method call fails. It can determine if the failure is retryable and have the call retried after a prescribed delay.
        Returns:
        The retry policy currently in effect. Never null
        Since:
        0.9.0.5 (RJF 4.0.5)

      • setRetryPolicy

        IRetryPolicy setRetryPolicy(IRetryPolicy policy)
        Sets the retry policy. Calls currently in progress will not be affected. New calls initiated after setting the policy will be. The retry policy dictates what to do when a service method call fails. It can determine if the failure is retryable and have the call retried after a prescribed delay.
        Parameters:
        The - new retry policy to go into effect. If null the default retry policy will be used.
        Returns:
        The retry policy that was in effect.
        Since:
        0.9.0.5 (RJF 4.0.5)
